markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Holy Water](/Equipment.aspx?ID=245)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Good" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=83" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Splash" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=150" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 571 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 3 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Strike</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This vial contains water blessed by a good deity. You activate a vial of _holy water_ by throwing it as a Strike. It’s a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn’t add the manipulate trait to the attack made with it.

 _Holy water_ deals 1d6 good damage and 1 good splash damage. It damages only fiends, undead, and creatures that have a weakness to good damage.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Holy Water

text: <title level="1" right="Item 1" pfs="Standard" > Holy Water Source Core Rulebook pg. 571 4.0 Price 3 gp Usage held in 1 hand Bulk L Activate Single Action Strike --- This vial contains water blessed by a good deity. You activate a vial of holy water by throwing it as a Strike. It’s a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn’t add the manipulate trait to the attack made with it. Holy water deals 1d6 good damage and 1 good splash damage. It damages only fiends, undead, and creatures that have a weakness to good damage.
